data.title: Make Atom run on Debian 7 Wheezy
data.body:
Related to #2131 #3926

https://github.com/atom/atom claims that Atom runs on Debian. It doesn't. 

The .deb file can not be installed because of a naming conflict. 

I can buld it on Debian it still doesn't run. 

GLIBC_2.14 and/or GLIBC_2.15 is required. No, installing that from the experimental repo is not a good idea. 

So, please make Atom run on Debian 7 Wheezy.

data.title: Confirm dialog buttons get cut off when there's too many
data.body:
The confirm dialog buttons look a little weird when there's too many buttons in a dialog. Buttons get cut off the window edge. Screenshot for clarity:
![atom.confirm() buttons cut off](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3612514/5220958/1cbc3cb0-766f-11e4-94b4-5fb5fa4ecdd4.png)

data.title: ctrl + delete shortcut
data.body:
given the following json code on editor (the pipeline <kbd>|</kbd> represents cursors position)

```
collections : {"profile": 'data.json', "users":[ |
]}
```

if I press <kbd>ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>delete</kbd> I would expect the code to look like this:

```
collections : {"profile": 'data.json', "users":[ | ]}
```

_NOT_ like this

```
collections : {"profile": 'data.json', "users":[ |
```

_Conclusion_

the shortcut should only delete the white space not any other characters IMO, I may be wrong though and this may be down to preference, but I know most editors have this behaviour.

data.title: Cmd-d to select next instance of selected double quote does not work
data.body:
If I have a single quotation mark selected, and press Cmd-d, the next single quotation is selected.

If I have a double quotation mark selected, and press Cmd-d, nothing happens.

data.title: Reopen file after renaming it in tree view
data.body: After renaming a file in the tree view, Atom closes the file, but what I'd actually expect is Atom to close the file, rename it and open it again, placing the cursor on the line/column I previously was.

data.title: Installing atom without sudo privilidges
data.body: When atempting to compile atom from source on a university machine without user privilidges tons of access errors occur (1. the npm version is not 1.4 and compiling a local  node + running from that does not work). Is there a way to just obtain a compiled form to run ? for example sublime is easy to install without user prvilidges. Can this be added ?

data.title: Add a script/install
data.body: `script/build` is asymmetric to `script/grunt install` and gives me papercuts. How can this be redirected in a portable manner?

data.title: In panel-element, call space pen attach hooks after attached
data.body: Currently, the attach callbacks are called before the panel item is actually attached to the DOM, so if they try to read/modify things like focus, it won't work.

data.title: Files lines breaks
data.body:
Hi,

Noticed that every time i modified for example a line of a file in my project, the editor seems to be automatically modifying the line breaks, spacing or tabs in other sections of the file, is it a default behavior?, is there any way to disable it? i only want to get reflected the line i am fixing.

Thanks in advance

data.title: Atom "New Changelog" Icon shows after updating, config.cson not updated
data.body:
Each time atom updates, I get that little blue "there's new changelog to view" icon after bootup.
Doing view/reload or opening a new window results in it being gone. It's just the first window after restart that it shows up.

One last thing I noticed:
In confif.cson 

``` json
  'release-notes':
    'viewedVersion': '0.94.0'
```

`viewedVersion` is never updated. Is that purposeful?

data.title: Add ‘position’ option to overlay decorations
data.body:
/cc @benogle

By default overlays are positioned at the head of the given marker. This option allows them to be positioned at the tail instead by passing `position: ’tail’` when creating the decoration, which is useful for autocomplete.

I tried various other approaches for positioning the overlay in autocomplete without adding this option, but the complexity of the text manipulation (due to the fact that the case of the prefix and suffix can be altered) meant that any other markers I created were always getting moved to undesirable places. Since we restore the selections following the text manipulation, simply positioning the overlay at the tail is the most convenient and simple approach.

data.title: Atom editor does not go to foreground when opened from console
data.body:
OS: Ubuntu 14.10
Atom version 0.152.0

Steps to reproduce:
1/ have Atom already opened
2/ in a console, open a file with atom (ex: atom foobar.php)

expected result:
File is loaded and Atom window is moved to the foreground

actual result:
File is loaded in the background, Atom window does not move to the foreground.

data.title: How do we start where we left?
data.body: Is there an option that we can tick on to continue where we closed atom instead of going through File->Open Dir and opening that directory?

data.title: Upgrade Windows README
data.body:
**Please review, first RP ever**

This updates Windows installation section of README and adds separate Chocolatey installation file, if user desires so.

Fixes #4321

data.title: README Windows installing section needs update
data.body:
:memo: Because the project now builds installers, Chocolatey is not needed anymore. So its section needs to be deleted or made less significant.

And link to the installer on frontpage of the project wouldn't be bad :laughing: Also, keeping docs up to date :arrow_up:

data.title: Random errors in console
data.body:
I say 'random' because this happened after leaving Atom in the background for maybe 15 minutes.

Note that my internet connection has been **really** finicky, so that's probably the source of the ERR_CONNECTION_CLOSED error.  Not sure about the other ones though...

```
Failed to load resource: net::ERR_CONNECTION_CLOSED https://www.google-analytics.com/collect?t=event&ec=command&ea=window&el=wi…id=f896320359d4d1fabd343d723e32a91017ad066a&an=atom&av=0.150.0&sr=1366x768
```

Possibly related to #4244 (might have been caused by the auto-updater)?

Atom 0.150.0, Windows 7 x64, **non-safe mode**.

data.title: Split shortcut in treeview
data.body: The split key combo doesn't work when the Treeview is active. I would say its a limitation but the Find combo activates so I know its possible.

data.title: 0.152 ctrl-shift-P / command-palette is not working anymore
data.body:
iam running atom on a arch linux and i just updated to the 0.152 rls and now ctrl-shift-P is not working anymore.
When I Press that combination nothing happens.
ctrl-p is working.

data.title: Remove deprecations from core
data.body:
In progress. Feel free to take bits of it if you'd like.
### TODO
- [ ] Remove `Point.translate` calls, use `Point.add`? See `text-editor-spec` and `text-editor-component-spec`, @nathansobo a while ago, I swapped `add` for `translate` and specs were failing. 
- [ ] Use checkpoints rather than transactions? See `text-editor-spec` and `text-editor-component-spec`. @nathansobo or @maxbrunsfeld 
- [ ] Upgrade the theme manager specs. Several events are asking for using something on atom.styles. Not sure if we want to test these or suppress. @nathansobo this is your domain.

data.title: Cannot change between windows with cmd+` It writes the character ` instead. I'm using OS X Yosemite.
Zoom shortcut keys don't work with French keyboard
data.body:
Version: 0.152.0
OS: Ubuntu 14.10 (Unity environement)
Locale: fr_FR

In Atom, the zooming shortcut to zoom in (ctrl+ & ctrl+shift+) works, but not the zoom out (ctrl-) and zoom reset (ctrl+0).

The command work from the palette. No errors in the debug console. Could it be that shortcut are hardcoded to the layout of a US Qwerty keyboard which has a different layout?

I also tried with ctrl+shift+- and ctrl+shift+0 with no success.

Thanks

data.title: Improved "Show Invisibles"
data.body:
I'm not a big fan of eclipse, but regarding the "show invisibles" feature, it provides some realy nice configuration:
- changing the opacity of the invisible chars
- specify which type of chars to display (tabs, spaces, line endings etc)
- specify which type chars to display depending on their position (leading, enclosed, trailing)

That's awesome, since I like to reduce the opacity and hide the line endings, enclosed whitespace and stuff (I just want to see the the leading whitespace type with a low opacity).

It would be awesome to have similar options in atom.

![invisibles](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/107634/5183318/0e366e44-74ae-11e4-8f6c-1d2274129f8d.png)

data.title: Atom is Displaying the incorrect release notes
data.body:
I updated to version 0.152.0 and its showing me these release notes below

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7794777/5178760/e87e9dee-747a-11e4-983b-187d2b6a0cf3.PNG)

data.title: Fix ordering of panels in panel containers
data.body:
An off-by-one error caused new panels to be inserted later in the document than intended.

This caused the find-and-replace panel to appear below the status bar.

data.title: Make programmatic scrolling more transitional and less jumpy
data.body: The autoscroll option for many programmatic methods right now is way too jumpy and really negatively impacts UX. It would be nice to be able to say `.setBufferPosition(position, { autoscroll: true, transitionDuration: '0.5s', transitionTiming: 'ease' })` or something similar that will provide developers a way to transition the editor how they see fit. If the transition duration and timing aren't provided, then fall back to a nice `'0.3s'` and `'ease'` or something like that.

data.title: Integrate notifications into core
data.body:
This does 2 things:
- Make the notifications package a bundled package
- Add notifications (Errors) for issues when loading files (config, keymap, snippets)

There is an issue on error where two messages are displayed. 

![screen shot 2014-11-24 at 5 21 01 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/69169/5176450/4c2aa1bc-73fe-11e4-9c40-a6602b794f7e.png)

This is caused by https://github.com/atom/node-pathwatcher/issues/50. I've worked around it in the notifications package by not displaying duplicates until after some amount of time https://github.com/atom/notifications/commit/c9f17d1db6ebab36f61526ead3fc83608549b585.

Closes #4212 
Closes #3524

data.title: No focus after Alt+Tab
data.body: Atom does not get focus after changing the window to it using `Alt+Tab`. I need to click into the editor before can start typing. That is annoying and should not be necessary.
